summary: It's been a while (exactly 17 years lol), that I did not pick up a crayon... And, well, I had a lot of fun (it was a Christmas...
body:
It’s been a while (exactly 17 years lol), that I did not pick up a crayon… And, well, I had a lot of fun (it was a Christmas present for my best friend), contrary to expectation 😂

I continue to prefer my trusty pencil and the black and white, btw! 😅

summary: How to start a war
title: How to start a war
body:
Summary:

“I have a plan.” 

“A plan to what? Wake us all up in the middle of the night?” Clint enters the room, still in his pajamas.

“A plan to stop the tickler among us.”

Pairing: Tony Stark x Reader

Warning: Cursing? Dirty mentions? (nothing big)

Wordcount: 1100+

AN: ‘Ello, it’s me with the first fic of the week! I’ve got 7 planned (for now)! So at least one fic a day! YAY! Anyways, thanks you guys for reading, I hope you enjoy this!

Thank you @artisticlales for requesting this! I hope you like this!

My heart is beating erratically. My hands trembling at my sides and the bed feels unnaturally cold. I open my eyes and… darkness. My hand falls on her side of the bed, the only thing on my mind being her warmth. I need to feel her. But… she’s not there. I want to keep my cool. I want to just go back to sleep and forget the nightmares. But… she’s not there. My breathing quickens and my eyes dash from one side of the room to the other, wondering where the hell she is.

Then, the door opens. A single ray of light and her. That’s all I need to calm down. That’s all I need for my breathing to turn back to normal and for my heart to stop stuttering. She’s here. She’s safe.

“Tony, why’re you awake?” she asks, her voice lower than a whisper.

“Nightmare,” I answer and she smiles sadly.

“I’m sorry. I had to go pee.” She giggles and shifts to lay back down in bed. I hum in acknowledgement and for a second, it seems like she’s wondering whether it’d be better to touch me or not.

“What’re you waiting for? Come here.” I open my arms and she snuggles right in.

Our room is quiet. It’s peaceful. It feels like heaven. But not because of the soft bedsheets or the aromatic smells coming from the diffuser. No. In the dark, it’s her touch that feels like a little piece of heaven. A piece of heaven that is only mine. Warm. Cozy. Her warm breath making me shiver in pleasure. Her fingers drawing patterns on my chest, moving down towards my sides…

My eyes grow wide. Oh god.

Her fingers dive for the kill, skillfully moving against my ribcage as a high-pitched yelp leaves my lips and I jump up and… off the bed. She smirks. Oh god, she’s going to be the death of me.

“Now, Y/N, honey…” My hands are in front of me as I stand up, as if trying to tame a dangerous animal. Which, right now, she is. “I don’t think it’s a good idea for you to do that.”

She shuffles towards me, eyes looking innocent. Oh, but she’s everything but that. “I thought you weren’t ticklish, Tony. Have you been lying to me?” she asks, moving to stand up as I back away towards the door, ready to make a run for it.

“No, darling… I’ve just been… withholding some information,” I say.

“Wasn’t it you who said it was the same thing?” She’s moving closer and closer, like a predatory animal stalking its pray. She eyes all of the points on my body she thinks might be ticklish, a smirk forming on her lips when they land on my love-bitten neck.

As soon as I see that she’s distracted, I bolt. “Tony!” Her voice booms behind me, her laughter following it. “I thought you’d know better than to run, darling!”

Now, I know some people might think I’m being a little harsh. But in my defense, most people don’t know Y/N. Sure, she might be a great girlfriend and a great lover but she has one flaw… She’s an absolute tickle freak. Meaning, as soon as she finds out you’re ticklish, you’re done for. She’ll jab her hands to your sides, fingers moving quicker than lightning and you’ll be left in a puddle of tears and laughter on the floor.

Steve had been the first one to fall prey to her antics. The great captain had yielded in no less than twenty seconds. Then, the next one was Clint. He had managed to hide his weakness for a while, but as soon as her fingers touched his knees, he was done for. Even Natasha hadn’t managed to escape her.

Thor, Loki, T’Challa, Peter, even Wanda, they had all failed. The only ones she hadn’t touched was me, because I have great control over my body, and Bruce, in fear that she might unleash the Hulk.

All heroes have weaknesses. Thor’s is his brother. Steve’s is Bucky. Natasha’s… well Natasha’s I don’t know. But mine… Mine is a very determined girlfriend, her mind fixed on making me cave in and admit to my ticklishness. Something I am not willing to do.

“What’s happening?” Steve says as he enters the room.

“I have a plan.” I stand at the head of the table in our conference room, the Avengers gathered before me.

“A plan to what? Wake us all up in the middle of the night?” Clint enters the room, still in his pajamas.

“A plan to stop the tickler among us.”

The plan is soon put into action. Y/N is sitting at the table, coffee and waffles in front of her, unsuspecting about what is about to happen. Poor, innocent Y/N. I give the signal. Steve and Bucky are by her sides in less than a second, grabbing her arms and pulling her off the chair. Her eyes are wide and shifting between the two super-soldiers, who don’t utter a word.

They bring her to the room, sit her on the chair, just as instructed. They both hold her down, but Bucky seems a bit unnerved by this whole thing.

“What… what are you guys doing?” she asks them. That’s when I step in.

“Tony, baby, what is this? Some new kind of foreplay? I’m not into it.” Her mouth is saying one thing, her eyes are telling me another. Sure, she might be a bit afraid, but she knows I won’t hurt her.

“No foreplay, payback.” I smirk as I approach her, my hands skillfully pulling the socks off her feet. She looks at me with wide eyes, finally realizing what this is about.

She opens her mouth to say something, but my hands are quicker, working tiny circles at the soles of her feet. Only, it doesn’t seem to work. She’s not squirming, body calm as ever. She’s not laughing, instead her lips pull up into a smirk and her eyebrows slowly move up.

“Great plan… only… it has one little mistake,” she says. “I’m not ticklish.”

Steve’s and Bucky’s eyes widen and oh, they know they’ll be in for it after this. They but run out of the room, screaming good luck as the door shuts behind them.

I shake my head.

She walks up to me, a smile on her face and a skip in her step and I realized, I played right into her game. Now she had a reason to torture us with her tickles. I had started a tickle war.

Her eyes scan my own scared ones and she smirks as she walks out of the room, probably to find my accomplices. Oh… now I know I’m in for it.


Taglist:

@artisticlales @theoneanna @imnotusedtobeingloved @im-a-slut-for-an-accent @sherala007 @kcd15 @drakesfiance @thequeenofgood

The plan is soon put into action. Y/N is sitting at the table, coffee and waffles in front of her, unsuspecting about what is about to happen. Poor, innocent Y/N. I give the signal. Steve and Bucky are by her sides in less than a second, grabbing her arms and pulling her off the chair. Her eyes are wide and shifting between the two super-soldiers, who don’t utter a word.

They bring her to the room, sit her on the chair, just as instructed. They both hold her down, but Bucky seems a bit unnerved by this whole thing.

“What… what are you guys doing?” she asks them. That’s when I step in.

“Tony, baby, what is this? Some new kind of foreplay? I’m not into it.” Her mouth is saying one thing, her eyes are telling me another. Sure, she might be a bit afraid, but she knows I won’t hurt her.

“No foreplay, payback.” I smirk as I approach her, my hands skillfully pulling the socks off her feet. She looks at me with wide eyes, finally realizing what this is about.

She opens her mouth to say something, but my hands are quicker, working tiny circles at the soles of her feet. Only, it doesn’t seem to work. She’s not squirming, body calm as ever. She’s not laughing, instead her lips pull up into a smirk and her eyebrows slowly move up.

“Great plan… only… it has one little mistake,” she says. “I’m not ticklish.”

Steve’s and Bucky’s eyes widen and oh, they know they’ll be in for it after this. They but run out of the room, screaming good luck as the door shuts behind them.

I shake my head.

She walks up to me, a smile on her face and a skip in her step and I realized, I played right into her game. Now she had a reason to torture us with her tickles. I had started a tickle war.

Her eyes scan my own scared ones and she smirks as she walks out of the room, probably to find my accomplices. Oh… now I know I’m in for it.

Summary:

“I have a plan.” 

“A plan to what? Wake us all up in the middle of the night?” Clint enters the room, still in his pajamas.

“A plan to stop the tickler among us.”

Pairing: Tony Stark x Reader

Warning: Cursing? Dirty mentions? (nothing big)

Wordcount: 1100+

AN: ‘Ello, it’s me with the first fic of the week! I’ve got 7 planned (for now)! So at least one fic a day! YAY! Anyways, thanks you guys for reading, I hope you enjoy this!

Thank you @artisticlales for requesting this! I hope you like this!

My heart is beating erratically. My hands trembling at my sides and the bed feels unnaturally cold. I open my eyes and… darkness. My hand falls on her side of the bed, the only thing on my mind being her warmth. I need to feel her. But… she’s not there. I want to keep my cool. I want to just go back to sleep and forget the nightmares. But… she’s not there. My breathing quickens and my eyes dash from one side of the room to the other, wondering where the hell she is.

Then, the door opens. A single ray of light and her. That’s all I need to calm down. That’s all I need for my breathing to turn back to normal and for my heart to stop stuttering. She’s here. She’s safe.

“Tony, why’re you awake?” she asks, her voice lower than a whisper.

“Nightmare,” I answer and she smiles sadly.

“I’m sorry. I had to go pee.” She giggles and shifts to lay back down in bed. I hum in acknowledgement and for a second, it seems like she’s wondering whether it’d be better to touch me or not.

“What’re you waiting for? Come here.” I open my arms and she snuggles right in.

summary: You make me feel brand new
title: You make me feel brand new
body:
(Originally posted on Ao3 for Fandom Stocking)

Pairing: Steve/Tony
Word count: 2,006
Genre: established relationship, fluff, emotional hurt/comfort
Rating: T


Tony and Steve watch the last car drive away from their wedding reception.

The law banning same-sex marriage had just been abolished, and Tony has friends with enough influence to allow them a semi-formal ceremony, resembling a proper wedding even if it can’t be labeled as such, here in New York City.

It hadn’t been a big ceremony, with only their closest friends and Avengers teammates there, so they only have to gather a few things and settle a couple of others before they’re allowed to leave as well.

Soft music is still playing in the background, and it just lulls them both into a content, motionless adagio before they have to move and go home.

Steve brings his right arm around Tony’s waist and pulls him closer. He’s leaning on the open doorway, the night wind soothing their tuxedoed bodies with fresh air. Tony feels warm and happy right there at Steve’s side, as though his life couldn’t get better than this.

Steve is his husband now, and Tony knows he’s living on stolen time, but it’s the first day of said stolen time, so he feels even more justified than usual to turn his head a little and nuzzle Steve’s neck, before kissing it softly. Steve sighs a little at the touch and holds him closer still, tilting his head just so. Tony can feel the smile on the other man’s face as he gives him a soft, barely-there kiss.

Muffled piano notes mark the beginning of the new song, and Tony recognizes it after a couple of seconds. He smiles, heart warming up, and he’s filled with the sudden impulse to go along with the feeling and not squash it down, just this once.

He deserves some happiness at least on his wedding day, doesn’t he?

In all the years he’s known Steve, he’s never once thought he could be worthy of the other man – the amazing, splendid person that is now his husband. He didn’t think he was worthy of him back when Steve first kissed him. He didn’t think it when Steve fought alongside him, defended him and protected him. He didn’t think it when Steve first said he loved him.

He didn’t think it when Steve got on his knee and honest-to-god asked him to spend the rest of their lives together, because life – especially for them – was too unpredictable and risky not to live every single minute like their last.

He didn’t think he was worthy of Captain America’s love, but that was okay. It is okay.

The important thing had never been Tony’s happiness. He knows he has issues – who even knows how many – and being happy had always felt more like a dream rather than a real possibility. No, it’s always been about the perfect, idealistic, pure person that somehow chose to love the broken mess he is. It’s always been about Steve.

Steve chose to love him, and all Tony can do is never let him regret it.

All Tony can do is try to become a better person day after day, moment after moment. He never wants that sparkle in Steve’s eyes, the one he gets when he’s looking at Tony, to disappear. He never wants to crush Steve’s expectations or hurt his feelings, he never wants Steve to second-guess himself.

When Steve proposed to him, Tony had to go against all his rational thoughts telling him to say no – because, no matter how impossibly much he loved Steve, he couldn’t possibly deny him the chance of finding a person more worthy than he is of Steve’s love.

But then he saw Steve’s face, his earnest expression, his eyes bright with love and desire and burning hope, and Tony just couldn’t bring himself to crush all that.

So, he allowed himself to be selfish once again – nothing new there – and said yes.

Besides, saying no would only mean Tony didn’t believe in them enough to give it a proper chance, or, even worse, that he didn’t love Steve as much as Steve loved him.

And today has been the happiest day of his life, so he goes all-in.

“Mr. Stark, may I have this dance?”

For a second, Steve doesn’t turn. Then he does, eyes glimmering with affection, love and a tiny speck of amusement. He meets Tony’s eyes as he squeezes him just so. “It would be my pleasure, Mr. Rogers.”

summary: Stumbling
title: Stumbling
body:
read it on the AO3 at http://bit.ly/2RIzxe0

by olivemartini

“Can you believe it?” Ned is way too happy, almost as giddy as he had been when he found out that Peter was spiderman. “We’re in London!”
They were in London. For two days, and then off to Paris, and then down to Italy.
“Yeah, cheer up, Parker.” Flash bobbed between them. Peter had to readjust the suitcases (he had three. His, and Suzy’s, because she kept dropping it and spilling more clothes, and MJ, because he had sort of just wanted to do something nice and she was pretty sure that it was hard for her to carry, considering that she had stuffed the bottom full of books.) to make space for him, and Flash manages to knock into them anyways. “We’re in Europe. What can go wrong?”
Later, he really wishes he hadn’t said that, but at the time, Peter had only laughed, because really, Flash was right.
He was with his friends. He was in Europe. He was carrying three suitcases in front of MJ, which had to be impressive. The suit was back at home, and he wasn’t going to keep someone from being mugged, unless they looked really upset about it.

a.k.a

My take on FFH, with plenty of Spideychelle thrown in the mix

body:

summary: tom ford be damned
title: tom ford be damned
body:
fluff, de-ageing

steve rogers gets turned into a toddler.
this is how tony stark handles it.

ao3

“I- what- what is this?”

Tony Stark, a man notorious for never shutting up was stunned to silence by the frankly adorable two-year-old on Thor’s shoulders, who looked suspiciously like - “Steve?”

The kid– toddler? gave him a wide, toothy grin at the sound of his name and nodded enthusiastically, blond hair flopping over his forehead. “Thor, buddy,” Tony said, through gritted teeth, he didn’t bode well with children, lest he become like his father, “why is my boyfriend a baby?” he asked, glaring up at the god of thunder. He was incredibly aware of how strong Thor was but, honestly, he didn’t care right now. Because his boyfriend was a baby.

Thor was, admittedly, a little scared, “Uh, my brother, Loki, had a fight with the Grandmaster, if you ask me, they’ve been on the rocks for a couple days now, but anyway, he came here to blow off some steam and, uh, now your Captain is two years of age, a rather mighty age, around the age Loki was when he first stabbed me. Anyway, he said it would probably only last a day or two or three maybe, he wasn’t very clear,” and with that, he swung baby-Steve off his shoulders and tried to hand him to Tony.

“No. No, no, no, no, nope. I don’t do kids or babies or toddlers, no-one under age ten,” they were all annoying and loud and messy and he was wearing Tom Ford, (most of them) were idiots who had no sense of the value of clothes (and small and breakable and very easily impressionable, he was not a good guy for kids to be around). And he didn’t want to be responsible for his boyfriend’s demise as a baby as a result of his terrible life-skills.

Natasha rolled her eyes, “For god’s sake Stark, take him, he clearly remembers you, he was crying until someone mentioned you and refused to leave Thor before now. He’s still the same Steve you love.”

“No, no, my Steve is an adult, not a baby,” Tony protested, even as Steve’s dimming grin tugged at his heartstrings.

“Oh my god, Tony, he is your Steve,” Clint said, exasperated, the kid was adorable , bright blue eyes, filled with innocence and curiosity and ridiculously messy blond hair that stuck out everywhere, Tony needed to get over himself.

“But…” Tony trailed off, eyes never leaving Steve, who had lost the bright smile all together and looked contemplative, as much as a toddler could look contemplative anyway.

Finally, in a small voice, Steve said, “‘ony no ‘yuv me?” He looked up at Tony, watery eyes begging him to prove him wrong, filled with hope and love and an innocence Tony had never seen in Steve before.

And Tony just fucking caved. Like a damn house of cards.

“No, no, Stevie,” Tony said, rushing forwards and reaching up to take him into his arms, “I love you, I love you so much, Stevie,” it felt wrong to call a baby Steve, and Stevie seemed to fit well, so Stevie it was.

Tony wondered, while Steve tried to bury himself in Tony, hands clutching tightly at any material he could get his hands on, Tom Ford be damned, Tony wondered, if he was called Stevie as a kid, way way way back when.

Steve lightly tapping him on his face, with his tiny tiny hand, knocked him out of his thoughts, “‘ony ‘ony ‘ony.”

“Yeah munchkin?” Jesus, he was adorable.

“I ‘yuv you ‘ony.” Steve said, bright grin back.
Tony kissed the crown of his head, just on his hairline, “I love you too, Stevie.”

“‘onyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyy,” Steve started, gazing up at Tony, “can w’ have ice cream?”
“Yup,” Tony agreed immediately, chest warming when Steve’s smile grew wider.

Steve had him completely and utterly wrapped around his tiny little finger.

And Tony found that he didn’t mind at all.

The next day, when Steve was back to normal, both him and Tony were happy for that (he suspected that Tony wanted another day with baby-him, he watched over some of the footage of baby-him and Tony playing together and drawing together, and it just confirmed his suspicions that he could, one day, build a family with Tony, and that, maybe, just maybe, the ring in his sock drawer could, maybe, be put on Tony’s finger. Maybe. Possibly.

-

summary: Good Girl (Tony Stark)
title: Good Girl (Tony Stark)
body:
Characters: Tony Stark

Universe: Marvel, Avengers

Warnings: PTSD, mention of animal abuse

Request:Could i have a request about tony stark having a ptsd and panic disorder since the new york invasion and he adopts a really shy service dog who used have an abused owner. And also i would like to add to my request that is tony x pepper,  shy service dog reader is afraid of avengers, fury and paparazi, tony comforts shy puppy reader in her nightmares about abusive own

“I’m not sure about this.” Tony commented for the hundredth time. Pepper rubbed his arm, making sure he didn’t just book it.

They were in a dog shelter, and while Tony usually followed his ‘no pets’ rule, Pepper had mentioned there was a dog here that was already trained to be a service dog for people suffering with PTSD- something Tony had. Tony only allowed her to actually come here to check the dog out, when she mentioned the dog was there and not working because it’s previous owner’s partner beat the dog.

“Alright, here she is!” One of the assistants announced, gently tugging on the leash so the dog would come in. Tony frowned at the sight of the dog literally shaking in fear, crouching and her tail tucked under her. “Come on, it’s okay!” The woman called.

“Hey there.” Tony slid off his seat, kneeling on the floor and offering his hand. The dog, was clearly interested, but daren’t get close.

“Sorry, she’s really skittish around new people.” The woman explained. Tony just kept his eyes focussed on the dog in front of him, who had plopped onto the floor, but was very slowly using her paws to shuffle forward, till her nose booped the tip of his fingers. In response to that, Tony gently moved to pet her chin, moving behind her ear. While it was clear she was still scared, she relaxed a little and leant into the petting.

“Her tail’s wagging.” Pepper whispered.

“Wow… you’re special, she hasn’t done that since she’s been here.” The woman responded. Tony smiled, now introducing his other hand so he could pet both ears, and he watched as the dog’s face slowly showed some content and calmness.

“Guess it’s a sign. I can adopt her, right?” Tony asked.

It was slow progress. He kept his dog mostly on the main floor of the tower, only leaving when she wanted or needed a walk. He quickly realised her boundaries. You were petrified of most of the avengers- notably the men, and she could only just stand being around Wanda and Natasha. Pepper  did a little better with her with since she’d known her longer, but she only acted more like an actual dog around Tony. She only wagged her tail when Tony came in the room or he called her name. The name was probably the hardest thing for Tony. He wanted something that would suit her and would also not make him feel silly for calling when out in public. It made it especially hard since she was barely showing her personality, so she ended up getting named two weeks later, as simply Baby. He chose it since he found himself calling her that often anyway.

He wasn’t an idiot, he knew dogs could have nightmares as well. She was kicking his legs as well, clearly trying to run, and he gently moved to get closer to her, and rested his hand on her back rubbing it.

The dog jolted, letting out a yelp, clearly confused at her surroundings, calming quickly though when she heard Tony cooing at her. “It’s alright Baby, I’m here.” He told her. The dog still whimpered, mimicking the same behaviour he’d seen when he adopted her. Shaking, tail between her legs. However, this time, she stood, and carefully moved closer to her owner, and just pressed herself against his chest. He hugged the dog, knowing she was now the one seeking reassurance. “Good girl. It’s okay.” He spoke softly, just cuddling her.
